question: 暦
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: When looking at a calendar, the <ja><reading>子読み</reading></ja> (<ja>こよみ</ja>) of it is to... well... not be able to read it at all. Because, children can't really read. So, when you look at a calendar you have to explain it to a child, since they cannot read it.
